message_1: How many different ways are there to partition a set of 7 distinct elements into smaller subsets?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to partition a set of 7 distinct elements into smaller subsets, we use the Bell number. The Bell number B(n) counts the number of different ways to partition a set with n elements.

For n = 7, the Bell number B(7) is 877.

So, there are 877 different ways to partition a set of 7 distinct elements into smaller subsets.
